newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Osprey secures US$944 mln loan.
newsitem.headline: Osprey secures US$944 mln loan.

text.p: Four banks said on Monday they had arranged a US$944 million syndicated debt facility to finance Osprey Maritime Ltd's acquisition of Gotaas-Larsen Shipping Corp.

Den Norske Bank ASA, Banque Indosuez, Christiania Bank OG Kreditkasse and Credit Suisse First Boston said in a statement the facility was structured as an acquisition financing of Gotaas-Larsen and a partial refinancing of Osprey.
It said the facility had a flexible structure and enables Osprey to proceed with their planned equity issues and re-capitalisation of the company.

The loan was underwritten by the four arrangers, together with ABN AMRO, MeesPierson and Societe Generale. Other institutions with established relationships with Osprey have been invited to join the facility, the statement said.
Osprey Maritime said on May 13 it would acquire 100 percent of Monaco-based Gotaas-Larsen for US$750 million.
